timeline.author: lkiesow

timeline.bodyText: Can we use OSGi annotations instead of specifying this in XML?
timeline.author: lkiesow
lkiesow

timeline.bodyText:
This test does not make any sense, does it?
Drop it.
timeline.author: lkiesow

timeline.bodyText: Are these tests intended to be used?
timeline.author: lkiesow

timeline.bodyText: Instead of checking this here, could we check it in modules/engage-theodul-plugin-tab-downloads/src/main/resources/static/main.js and have the plugin potentially do nothing instead? That way, we have no plug-in specific code in here.
timeline.author: lkiesow

timeline.bodyText: Why embed these files if they are empty anyway?
timeline.author: lkiesow

timeline.bodyText:
From what I can tell, these modes do the same thing: nothing.
Why handle them separately?
timeline.author: lkiesow

timeline.bodyText:
The maven-dependency-plugin complains about several dependencies in here.
You are also not really using any Jasmine or JUnit tests, are you?
timeline.author: lkiesow

timeline.message: Merge branch 'embedding_code' of git://github.com/jchssystems/opencast into develop

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            # Default: false
          
          
            
            allow_video_download: false
          
          
            
            # Default: true
          
          
            
            allow_video_download: true
timeline.author: lkiesow
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -65,6 +65,18 @@ link_mediamodule: true
 # Default: false
 show_embed_links: true
 
+# Shows/Hides the download tab under the theodul player.
+# In order to show up, the user also needs a role that matches the
+# regex in the following configuration 'allowed_roles_for_video_download'
+# Allowed values: true, false
+# Default: false
+allow_video_download: false

timeline.bodyText:
Let's be a bit more open by default but let's also make sure people understand that this is no security option.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            # Configures the roles that are allowed to see the download plugin
          
          
            
            # Allowed values: regular expressions (if any role of the user matches this regex, the download tab will be shown)
          
          
            
            # Default: ROLE_ADMIN
          
          
            
            allowed_roles_for_video_download: ROLE_ADMIN
          
          
            
            # Configures the roles that are allowed to see the download plugin.
          
          
            
            # Note that this does not restrict access to the media files itself.
          
          
            
            # Allowed values: regular expressions (if any role of the user matches this regex, the download tab will be shown)
          
          
            
            # Default: ROLE_USER
          
          
            
            allowed_roles_for_video_download: ROLE_USER
timeline.author: lkiesow
